CNNMoney: Verizon challenges FCC Net neutrality rules Verizon filed a legal appeal on Thursday challenging the Federal Communications Commission's authority to enforce the new Net neutrality rules it adopted last month. We believe this assertion of authority goes well beyond any authority provided by Congress, and creates uncertainty for the communications industry, innovators, investors and consumers, Verizon senior vice president and deputy general counsel Michael Eric Schmidt Glover said in a written statement.
